patterns: Hi there
How are you

responses: Hello, thanks for asking
Good to see you again

patterns: Retrieve the names of all employees
responses: SELECT name FROM employees;

patterns: Create a database named shop_db
responses: CREATE DATABASE shop_db;

patterns: Create a table named products with columns id, name, and price
responses: CREATE TABLE products (id INT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(100), price DECIMAL(10,2));

patterns: Find all products priced above $50
responses: SELECT * FROM products WHERE price > 50;

patterns: List all customers from New York
responses: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE city = 'New York';

patterns: Get the total number of orders placed
responses: SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_orders FROM orders;

patterns: Show all orders placed in 2023
responses: SELECT * FROM orders WHERE YEAR(order_date) = 2023;

patterns: Retrieve the top 5 best-selling products
responses: SELECT product_id, COUNT(*) AS sales FROM order_details GROUP BY product_id ORDER BY sales DESC LIMIT 5;

patterns: Find the average salary of employees in the IT department
responses: SELECT AVG(salary) AS avg_salary FROM employees WHERE department = 'IT';

patterns: List all students with grades above 90
responses: SELECT * FROM students WHERE grade > 90;

patterns: Retrieve all flights departing from JFK airport
responses: SELECT * FROM flights WHERE departure_airport = 'JFK';

patterns: Show the total revenue generated in November 2024
responses: SELECT SUM(amount) AS total_revenue FROM transactions WHERE MONTH(transaction_date) = 11 AND YEAR(transaction_date) = 2024;

patterns: Display the names of all employees hired after January 1, 2020
responses: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE hire_date > '2020-01-01';

patterns: Find the customer with the highest total purchase
responses: SELECT customer_id, SUM(amount) AS total_spent FROM transactions GROUP BY customer_id ORDER BY total_spent DESC LIMIT 1;

patterns: Retrieve all books published by 'Penguin Random House'
responses: SELECT * FROM books WHERE publisher = 'Penguin Random House';

patterns: Show all employees sorted by their last names in ascending order
responses: SELECT * FROM employees ORDER BY last_name ASC;

patterns: Count the number of tickets sold for each movie
responses: SELECT movie_id, COUNT(*) AS tickets_sold FROM tickets GROUP BY movie_id;

patterns: Retrieve all orders where the total amount exceeds $500
responses: SELECT * FROM orders WHERE total_amount > 500;

patterns: Display the details of customers who have not made any purchases
responses: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT customer_id FROM transactions);

patterns: Find the 3 most recent blog posts
responses: SELECT * FROM blog_posts ORDER BY publish_date DESC LIMIT 3;

patterns: Show the total sales for each product category
responses: SELECT category_id, SUM(amount) AS total_sales FROM transactions GROUP BY category_id;

patterns: List the names of all employees who are managers
responses: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE job_title = 'Manager';

patterns: Retrieve all products with 'laptop' in their name
responses: SELECT * FROM products WHERE name LIKE '%laptop%';

patterns: Show the names of all students enrolled in 'Mathematics 101'
responses: SELECT students.name FROM students JOIN enrollments ON students.id = enrollments.student_id JOIN courses ON enrollments.course_id = courses.id WHERE courses.name = 'Mathematics 101';

patterns: Count the number of distinct suppliers
responses: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT supplier_id) AS unique_suppliers FROM products;

patterns: Retrieve the highest grade in the 'Physics' course
responses: SELECT MAX(grade) AS highest_grade FROM grades WHERE course = 'Physics';

patterns: Find the top 10 customers by purchase frequency
responses: SELECT customer_id, COUNT(*) AS purchase_count FROM transactions GROUP BY customer_id ORDER BY purchase_count DESC LIMIT 10;

patterns: Show the number of employees in each department
responses: SELECT department, COUNT(*) AS employee_count FROM employees GROUP BY department;

patterns: Retrieve all movies released between 2010 and 2020
responses: SELECT * FROM movies WHERE release_year BETWEEN 2010 AND 2020;

patterns: Find all authors who have written more than 5 books
responses: SELECT author_id, COUNT(*) AS book_count FROM books GROUP BY author_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 5;

patterns: Show all products that are out of stock
responses: SELECT * FROM products WHERE stock_quantity = 0;

patterns: Retrieve the total duration of all projects for a specific client
responses: SELECT client_id, SUM(duration) AS total_duration FROM projects WHERE client_id = 101 GROUP BY client_id;
